sentences: Meie usuksid kõike seda, mida ta ütles.
Usuks mind ja võta see kingitus.
context: The word 'usuks' is the partitive singular form of the verb 'usuma', which means 'to believe' or 'to have faith'. In Estonian, the partitive case often indicates an incomplete action or result. Here it shows the belief being placed in something or someone.
